In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function in Julia that wraps a string based on a maximum width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = String[]
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(wrapped_text, line)
            line = ""
        end
        if !isempty(line)
            line *= " "
        end
        line *= word
    end
    if !isempty(line)
        push!(wrapped_text, line)
    end
    return join(wrapped_text, "\n")
end
```

This function splits the input text into words, then iterates over the words. If adding a word to the current line would exceed the maximum width, it adds the current line to the `wrapped_text` array and starts a new line. After the loop, it adds the last line to `wrapped_text` if it's not empty. Finally, it joins the lines in `wrapped_text` with newline characters and returns the result.

Here's an example of how to use this function:

```julia
julia> text = "This is a test string to demonstrate the string wrapping function."

julia> println(wrap_string(text, 10))
This is a
test
string to
demonstrate
the string
wrapping
function.
```

In this example, the function wraps the input string `text` with a maximum width of 10 characters. The output is a single string with newline characters between the wrapped lines.
